titleStmt.title: The E. of Shaftsbury's expedient for setling the nation Discoursed with His Majesty in the House of Peers at Oxford, Mar. 24th, 1680/1.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed, and are to be sold by Langley Curtis,

notesStmt.note: A satiric account of Shaftesbury's proposal to King Charles II to settle the crown on the Duke of Monmouth.
Item at reel 297:13 identified as Wing S2891A (number cancelled).
Item at reel 1776:7 identified as Wing E45A ("no entry" in Wing 2nd ed., rev.).
Item at reel 1776:7 imperfect: t.p. torn with partial loss of title and entire imprint.
Reproduction of originals at the University of Illinois (Urbana-Champaign Campus). Library, Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery, and Folger Shakespeare Library.
